definition: to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: Dehydration and fever can be treated with oral rehydration salts and paracetamol.
sentences.chinese: 脫水和發燒可用口服補液鹽和對乙酰氨基酚進行治療。

sentences.english: ORS and zinc bring the risk of death down to almost zero.
sentences.chinese: 而口服補液鹽和補鋅可幾乎完全消除死亡危險。

sentences.english: Position child with head of bed slightly elevated to decrease cerebral edema; monitor administration of fluids.
sentences.chinese: 臥牀時，牀頭略微擡高，減少腦水腫，監視補液情況。

sentences.english: Early rehydration can save the lives of nearly all cholera patients.
sentences.chinese: 及早補液可拯救幾乎所有霍亂患者的生命。

sentences.english: WHO recommends that travellers include oral rehydration salts in their medical kits.
sentences.chinese: 世衛組織建議旅行者在其醫療箱中包括口服補液鹽。

sentences.english: Cholera is easily treated with oral rehydration salts or intravenous fluids.
sentences.chinese: 通過口服補液鹽或靜脈注射，霍亂是很容易醫治的。

sentences.english: In the case of diarrhoea, reliable treatment exists in the form of oral rehydration salts and zinc.
sentences.chinese: 對於腹瀉病，可靠的治療方法就是口服補液鹽和鋅片。

sentences.english: Treatment is not generally required, except electrolyte replacement and rehydration.
sentences.chinese: 除去補充電解質和補液療法之外，通常並不需要治療。
